alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 11:31AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover, Pender, eastern Brunswick and east central Columbus Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Northwest to near Boiling Spring Lakes. Movement was north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Burgaw, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, North Masonboro Island, Snows Cut, Rich Inlet, South Masonboro Island, Johnny Mercer Pier, Figure Eight Island, Yaupon Beach, Hampstead, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James and Southport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 388 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 30 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
